result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Rossetti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA surcharge pursuant to Sec. 973.046(1r), Wis. Stats.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No contact with the victim, D.A.G., or the victim's mother, Cheryl Rossetti, or their residence.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before March 6, 2015 @ 8:00 am. Court STAYS all but sixty (60) days of the conditional release jail time. The defendant may serve his conditional release jail time in Waukesha County, and is eligible for electronic monitoring if available.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael J. Rossetti in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

MUST POST $1,000.00 CASH.   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.A.G. (DOB 2-11-11) OR MOM C. OR THEIR RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH ANY AND ALL D.H.S. REQUIREMENTS.
See signature bond set 3/20/14
Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney Julia May for bond purposes only. Joshua Grube appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
